txt.en: After trying to escape the wicked designs of Skorgrím Dourhand by fleeing Ered Luin, Erfith and his kin were ensnared by the goblins at Lhúngobel.
'Did Erfith send you? I knew he made it!'
'I'd had just about enough of these goblins!'

Erfith can be found on a hill just off the road near the border of Ered Luin in Yondershire.\n\nYou have successfully freed several of Erfith's kin from the goblins at Lhúngobel. You should talk to Erfith.

'[placeholder]?'

Erfith's face brightens, if only for a moment.

'You were right. I did not heed your warnings, and I should've listened. Something horrid has taken hold of my kinsfolk. I do not even recognize them anymore!

'A few of my companions and I resolved to strike out on our own after Skorgrím departed Ered Luin, but it wasn't long before our kinsfolk sent the goblins after us! It was Glúmir, a wicked champion of my people, who issued that order, but it matters not. The goblins pursued us across the Lune to Lhúngobel and I only narrowly escaped.

'They've got my companions, [placeholder], and it won't be long before they drag them back to Glúmir and the others still loyal to Skorgrím!

'Won't you help me?'

'I hardly know what to say...

'After all we have done, you owe us nothing and yet you have lent us your aid. You have my truest thanks, [placeholder].

'My companions and I will not trouble the folk of Ered Luin ever again. I promise it!'
Free Dourhands from the goblins at Lhúngobel ([placeholder]/[placeholder])

'I hardly know what to say...

'After all we have done, you owe us nothing and yet you have lent us your aid. You have my truest thanks, [placeholder]. My companions and I will not trouble the folk of Ered Luin ever again. I promise it! 

'We Dourhands have much to atone for, and if the deeds of Skorgrím and his lot go unanswered, I fear we shall never again be welcome among the peoples of Middle-earth.

'You are a different sort of dwarf, my friend—if I may call you such. I wish more of my kinsfolk were like you!'

'Something horrid has taken hold of my kinsfolk. I do not even recognize them anymore!

'A few of my companions and I resolved to strike out on our own after Skorgrím departed Ered Luin, but it wasn't long before our kinsfolk sent the goblins after us! It was Glúmir, a wicked champion of my people, who issued that order, but it matters not. The goblins pursued us across the Lune to Lhúngobel and I only narrowly escaped.

'The goblins have my companions. It won't be long before they drag them back to Glúmir and the others still loyal to Skorgrím!

'Won't you help me?'

Lhúngobel can be found along the River Lune in the north-western reaches of Yondershire.\n\nErfith has asked you to free his companions that were captured by the goblins at Lhúngobel. Dourhands can be found in the ruins of Lhúngobel.
Freed Dourhands from the goblins at Lhúngobel ([placeholder]/[placeholder])
